00051 #ifdef TSV_USE_RDBUF
00052 #define M_GETC()    (m_rdbuf->sbumpc())
00053 #define M_PEEK()    (m_rdbuf->sgetc())
00054 #define M_UNGETC(c) (m_rdbuf->sputbackc(c))

00056 #define M_GETC()    (m_fileStream.get())

00064 // Chars literials in numeric form (so they arent converted
00065 // by the compiler) should be an enum?
00066 
00068 #define TSV_CHAR_TAB     (0x09)
00070 #define TSV_CHAR_LF      (0x0a)
00072 #define TSV_CHAR_CR      (0x0d)
00074 #define TSV_CHAR_COMMENT (0x23)
00076 #define TSV_CHAR_SPACE   (0x20)
00078 #define TSV_CHAR_EOF     (-1)
00080 #define TSV_STRING_COMMENT  "#"
00082 #define TSV_STRING_META     "#%"
00083 
00085 #define TSV_EOL_UNIX   "\n"
00087 #define TSV_EOL_WIN    "\r\n"

00089 // be nice to less fortunate users...

00092 #define TSV_EOL TSV_EOL_WIN
00093 #else
00094 #define TSV_EOL TSV_EOL_UNIX

00101 void
00102 affx::ltrim(std::string& str)
00103 {
00104   string::size_type pos=str.find_first_not_of(" \t");
00105   if (pos==std::string::npos) {
00106     str.erase();
00107   } else {
00108     str.erase(0,pos);
00109   }
00110 }
00111 
00114 void
00115 affx::rtrim(std::string& str)
00116 {
00117   string::size_type pos=str.find_last_not_of(" \t");
00118   if (pos==std::string::npos) {
00119     str.erase();
00120   } else {
00121     str.erase(pos+1);
00122   }
00123 }
00124 
00127 void
00128 affx::trim(std::string& str)
00129 {
00130   ltrim(str);
00131   rtrim(str);
00132 }
00133 
00136 void
00137 affx::dequote(std::string& str)
00138 {
00139   // we only trim paired quotes
00140   size_t str_size=str.size();
00141   if (str_size<2) {
00142     return;
00143   }
00144   // pick out first and last char
00145   unsigned char c_begin=str[0];
00146   unsigned char c_end=str[str_size-1];
00147   // paired quotes?
00148   if (((c_begin=='"')||(c_begin=='\''))&&(c_begin==c_end)) {
00149     str.erase(str.size()-1,1); // remove last quote
00150     str.erase(0,1);            // remove first quote
00151   }
00152 }
00153 
00159 int
00160 affx::splitstr(const std::string& str,char c,std::vector<std::string>& vec)
00161 {
00162   string::size_type pos1=0;
00163   string::size_type pos2=0;
00164   int num=0;
00165 
00166   vec.clear();
00167 
00168   while (1) {
00169     pos2=str.find(c,pos1);
00170     if (pos2==string::npos) {
00171       vec.resize(num+1);
00172       vec[num].assign(str,pos1,str.size()-pos1);
00173       break;
00174     } else {
00175       vec.resize(num+1);
00176       vec[num].assign(str,pos1,pos2-pos1);
00177       pos1=pos2+1;
00178     }
00179     ++num;
00180   }
00181   return num;
00182 }
00183 
00187 int
00188 affx::unescapeChar(int c)
00189 {
00190   switch (c) {
00191   case 'b': return   8 ; // backspace
00192   case 'e': return  27 ; // escape
00193   case 'f': return  12 ; // form feed
00194   case 'n': return  TSV_CHAR_LF ;
00195   case 'r': return  TSV_CHAR_CR ;
00196   case 't': return  TSV_CHAR_TAB;
00197   case 'v': return  11; // vertical tab
00198     // return the character unchanged.
00199   default: return c;
00200   }
00201 }
00202 
00203 int
00204 affx::escapeChar(int c)
00205 {
00206   switch (c) {
00207   case  8:           return   'b' ; // backspace
00208   case 27:           return   'e' ; // escape
00209   case 12:           return   'f' ; // form feed
00210   case TSV_CHAR_LF:  return   'n' ;
00211   case TSV_CHAR_CR:  return   'r' ;
00212   case TSV_CHAR_TAB: return   't' ;
00213   case 11:           return   'v' ; // vertical tab
00214   case '#':          return   '#' ; // comment char
00215     // no escape needed.
00216   default: return 0;
00217   }
00218 }
00219  
00220 std::string
00221 affx::escapeString(const std::string& str,const char eChar)
00222 {
00223   int i_max=str.size();
00224   std::string estring;
00225 
00226   estring.reserve(i_max);
00227 
00228   for (int i=0;i<i_max;i++) {
00229     char c=str[i];
00230     char cc=escapeChar(c);
00231     if (cc!=0) {
00232       estring.append(1,eChar);
00233       estring.append(1,cc);
00234     }
00235     else if (c==eChar) {
00236       estring.append(1,eChar);
00237       estring.append(1,c);
00238     }
00239     else {
00240       estring.append(1,c);
00241     }
00242   }
00243   
00244   return estring;
00245 }

00281 std::string
00282 TsvFileBinding::get_type_str()
00283 {
00284   if (m_ptr_int!=NULL) {
00285     return "int";
00286   }
00287   if (m_ptr_string!=NULL) {
00288     return "string";
00289   }
00290   if (m_ptr_float!=NULL) {
00291     return "float";
00292   }
00293   if (m_ptr_double!=NULL) {
00294     return "double";
00295   }
00296   if (m_ptr_uint!=NULL) {
00297     return "uint";
00298   }
00299   if (m_ptr_ulonglong!=NULL) {
00300     return "longlong";
00301   }
00302   //
00303   return "unbound";
00304 }

00336 void
00337 affx::TsvFileField::clear()
00338 {
00339   m_buffer="";
00340   m_isnull=true;
00341   //
00342   m_val_state=affx::VALSTATE_STRING;
00343   //
00344   m_value_int=0;
00345   m_value_int_done=false;
00346   m_value_int_rv=0;
00347   m_value_double=0.0;
00348   m_value_double_done=false;
00349   m_value_double_rv=0;
00350   m_value_uint=0;
00351   m_value_uint_done=false;
00352   m_value_uint_rv=0;
00353   m_value_ulonglong=0;
00354   m_value_ulonglong_done=false;
00355   m_value_ulonglong_rv=0;
00356   // default is 6 places "0.000000"
00357   m_precision=TSV_DEFAULT_PRECISION;
00358 }

00394 bool
00395 affx::TsvFileField::isEmpty()

00405 int
00406 affx::TsvFileField::setBuffer(const std::string& str)
00407 {
00408   // dont alias the buffer. "m_buffer=str;" might leave m_buffer as a reference
00409   m_buffer.erase();
00410   m_buffer.append(str.begin(),str.end());
00411   //
00412   m_val_state=affx::VALSTATE_STRING;
00413   //
00414   m_isnull=false;
00415   m_value_int_done=false;
00416   m_value_double_done=false;
00417   m_value_uint_done=false;
00418   m_value_ulonglong_done=false;
00419   return TSV_OK;
00420 }

00423 affx::TsvFileField::setPrecision(int places)
00424 {
00425   m_precision=places;
00426   return TSV_OK;
00427 }
00428 
00429 void
00430 affx::TsvFileField::convertToString()
00431 {
00432   switch (m_val_state) {
00433   case affx::VALSTATE_NONE:
00434     m_buffer.clear();
00435   case affx::VALSTATE_STRING:
00436     // do nothing; already a string
00437     break;
00438   case affx::VALSTATE_INT:
00439     {
00440       std::ostringstream stream;
00441       stream << m_value_int;
00442       setBuffer(stream.str());
00443     }
00444     break;
00445   case affx::VALSTATE_DOUBLE:
00446     {
00447       std::ostringstream stream;
00448       stream.setf(ios::fixed, ios::floatfield);
00449       stream.precision(m_precision);
00450       stream << m_value_double;
00451       setBuffer(stream.str());
00452     }
00453     break;
00454   default:
00455     TSV_ERR_ABORT("TsvFileField::convertToString(): internal error. m_val_state="+ToStr(m_val_state));
00456     break;
00457   }
00458 }
00459 
00461 #define TSV_NULL_RETURN(RV)  if (m_isnull) { *val=RV; return TSV_ERR_NULL; }
00462 
00466 int
00467 affx::TsvFileField::get(std::string* val)
00468 {
00469   TSV_NULL_RETURN("");
00470   //
00471   if (m_val_state!=affx::VALSTATE_STRING) {
00472     // we need the string version, convert it...
00473     convertToString();
00474   }
00475   // Avoid data sharing by clearing then appending the contents.
00476   val->erase();
00477   val->append(m_buffer.begin(),m_buffer.end());
00478   return TSV_OK;
00479 }
00480 
00484 int
00485 affx::TsvFileField::get(int* val)
00486 {
00487   TSV_NULL_RETURN(0);
00488   // done already?
00489   if (m_value_int_done) {
00490     *val=m_value_int;
00491     return m_value_int_rv;
00492   }
00493   //
00494   const char* ptr_start=m_buffer.c_str();
00495   char* ptr_end=NULL;
00496 
00498 
00499   // do the conversion (Force base 10)
00500   m_value_int=strtol(ptr_start,&ptr_end,10);
00501   // If m_ptr_end is not NULL then there was an invalid character.
00502   // If m_ptr_end == m_ptr_start then it was the null string. ("")
00503   if ((*ptr_end!=0)||(ptr_end==ptr_start)) {
00504     m_value_int=-1; // fill in with something off the end
00505     m_value_int_rv=TSV_ERR_CONVERSION; // signal an error
00506   }
00507   else {
00508     m_value_int_rv=TSV_OK;
00509   }
00510 
00511   m_value_int_done=true;
00512   *val=m_value_int;
00513   return m_value_int_rv;
00514 }
00515 
00519 int
00520 affx::TsvFileField::get(double* val)
00521 {
00522   TSV_NULL_RETURN(0.0);
00523   // done already?
00524   if (m_value_double_done) {
00525     *val=m_value_double;
00526     return m_value_double_rv;
00527   }
00528   //
00529   const char* ptr_start=m_buffer.c_str();
00530   char* ptr_end=NULL;
00531 
00532   // do the conversion
00533   m_value_double=strtod(ptr_start,&ptr_end);
00534   // same checks as strtol
00535   if ((*ptr_end!=0)||(ptr_end==ptr_start)) {
00536     m_value_double=-1.0; // bad value
00537     m_value_double_rv=TSV_ERR_CONVERSION; // signal an error
00538   } else {
00539     m_value_double_rv=TSV_OK;
00540   }
00541 
00542   m_value_double_done=true;
00543   *val=m_value_double;
00544   return m_value_double_rv;
00545 }
00546 
00550 int
00551 affx::TsvFileField::get(float* val)
00552 {
00553   if (m_value_double_done) {
00554     *val=(float)m_value_double;
00555     return m_value_double_rv;
00556   }
00557   // Get the double value and cast it.
00558   double tmp_double;
00559   int rv;
00560   rv=get(&tmp_double);
00561   *val=(float)tmp_double;
00562   return rv;
00563 }
00564 
00568 int
00569 affx::TsvFileField::get(unsigned int* val)
00570 {
00571   TSV_NULL_RETURN(0);
00572   // done already?
00573   if (m_value_uint_done) {
00574     *val=m_value_uint;
00575     return m_value_uint_rv;
00576   }
00577   //
00578   const char* m_ptr_start=m_buffer.c_str();
00579   char* m_ptr_end=NULL;
00580 
00581   // do the conversion
00582   m_value_uint=strtoul(m_ptr_start,&m_ptr_end,10);
00583   if ((*m_ptr_end)!=0) {
00584     m_value_uint=0; // fill in zero on error.
00585     m_value_uint_rv=TSV_ERR_CONVERSION; // signal it.
00586   } else {
00587     m_value_uint_rv=TSV_OK;
00588   }
00589 
00590   m_value_uint_done=true;
00591   *val=m_value_uint;
00592   return m_value_uint_rv;
00593 }

00598 int
00599 affx::TsvFileField::get(uint64_t* val)
00600 {
00601   TSV_NULL_RETURN(0);
00602   // done already?
00603   if (m_value_ulonglong_done) {
00604     *val=m_value_ulonglong;
00605     return m_value_ulonglong_rv;
00606   }
00607   //
00608   const char* m_ptr_start=m_buffer.c_str();
00609   char* m_ptr_end=NULL;
00610 
00611   // do the conversion
00612 #ifndef WIN32
00613   m_value_ulonglong=strtoull(m_ptr_start,&m_ptr_end,10);
00614 #else
00615   m_value_ulonglong=_strtoui64(m_ptr_start,&m_ptr_end,10);
00616 #endif
00617   if ((*m_ptr_end)!=0) {
00618     m_value_ulonglong=0; // fill in zero on error.
00619     m_value_ulonglong_rv=TSV_ERR_CONVERSION; // signal it.
00620   } else {
00621     m_value_ulonglong_rv=TSV_OK;
00622   }
00623 
00624   m_value_ulonglong_done=true;
00625   *val=m_value_ulonglong;
00626   return m_value_ulonglong_rv;
00627 }

00631 #define TSV_SPLIT_VEC_BODY(TYPE)                  \
00632   int rv=affx::TSV_OK;                            \
00633   string::size_type pos1;                         \
00634   string::size_type pos2;                         \
00635   char* pos_out;                                  \
00636   TYPE val;                                       \
00637                                                   \
00638   vec->clear();                                   \
00639                                                   \
00640   if (m_buffer=="") {                             \
00641     return rv;                                    \
00642   }                                               \
00643                                                   \
00644   pos1=0;                                         \
00645   while (1) {                                     \
00646     pos2=m_buffer.find(sep,pos1);                 \
00647     if (pos2==string::npos) {                     \
00648       val=CONVERT_FUNC();                         \
00649       vec->push_back(val);                        \
00650       break;                                      \
00651     } else {                                      \
00652       val=CONVERT_FUNC();                         \
00653       vec->push_back(val);                        \
00654       pos1=pos2+1;                                \
00655     }                                             \
00656   }                                               \
00657   return rv;
00658 
00659 int
00660 affx::TsvFileField::get(std::vector<int>* vec,char sep)
00661 {
00662 #define CONVERT_FUNC() strtol(&m_buffer[pos1],&pos_out,10)
00663   TSV_SPLIT_VEC_BODY(int);
00664 #undef CONVERT_FUNC
00665 }
00666 int
00667 affx::TsvFileField::get(std::vector<float>* vec,char sep)
00668 {
00669 #define CONVERT_FUNC() (float)strtod(&m_buffer[pos1],&pos_out)
00670   TSV_SPLIT_VEC_BODY(float);
00671 #undef CONVERT_FUNC
00672 }
00673 int
00674 affx::TsvFileField::get(std::vector<double>* vec,char sep)
00675 {
00676 #define CONVERT_FUNC() strtod(&m_buffer[pos1],&pos_out)
00677   TSV_SPLIT_VEC_BODY(double);
00678 #undef CONVERT_FUNC
00679 }
00680 
00681 int
00682 affx::TsvFileField::get(std::vector<std::string>* vec,char sep)
00683 {
00684   int rv=affx::TSV_OK;
00685   string::size_type pos1;
00686   string::size_type pos2;
00687   std::string val;
00688 
00689   vec->clear();
00690 
00691   if (m_buffer=="") {
00692     return rv;
00693   }
00694 
00695   pos1=0;
00696   while (1) {
00697     pos2=m_buffer.find(sep,pos1);
00698     if (pos2==string::npos) {
00699       val.assign(m_buffer,pos1,m_buffer.size()-pos1);
00700       vec->push_back(val);
00701       break;
00702     } else {
00703       val.assign(m_buffer,pos1,pos2-pos1);
00704       vec->push_back(val);
00705       pos1=pos2+1;
00706     }
00707   }
00708 
00709   return rv;
00710 }

00714 #define TSV_CONCAT_VEC_BODY() {                 \
00715   if (vec.size()>0) {                           \
00716     stream << vec[0];                           \
00717     for (int i=1;i<vec.size();i++) {            \
00718       stream << sep << vec[i];                  \
00719     }                                           \
00720   }                                             \
00721   setBuffer(stream.str());                      \
00722   return TSV_OK;                                \
00723   }

00780 #define TSV_CONVERT_FLOAT_BODY() {            \
00781   std::ostringstream stream;                  \
00782   stream.setf(ios::fixed, ios::floatfield);   \
00783   stream.precision(m_precision);              \
00784   stream << val;                              \
00785   return setBuffer(stream.str());             \
00786   }
00787 
00792 int
00793 affx::TsvFileField::set(float val)
00794 {
00795   //TSV_CONVERT_FLOAT_BODY();
00796   m_value_double=val;
00797   m_value_double_done=true;
00798   m_value_double_rv=TSV_OK;
00799   m_val_state=affx::VALSTATE_DOUBLE;
00800   return affx::TSV_OK;
00801 }
00806 int
00807 affx::TsvFileField::set(double val)
00808 {
00809   m_value_double=val;
00810   m_value_double_done=true;
00811   m_value_double_rv=affx::TSV_OK;
00812   m_val_state=affx::VALSTATE_DOUBLE;
00813   return affx::TSV_OK;
00814 }
00815 
00816 #undef TSV_CONVERT_FLOAT_BODY

00842 
00844 
00847 void
00848 affx::TsvFileField::linkedvar_push(affx::TsvFileBinding* var)
00849 {
00850   m_linkedvar_vec.push_back(var);
00851 }
00853 void
00854 affx::TsvFileField::linkedvars_clear()
00855 {
00856   m_linkedvar_vec.clear();
00857 }
00859 void
00860 affx::TsvFileField::linkedvars_assign(affx::TsvFile* tsvfile)
00861 {
00862   // Assign to the linked vars
00863   size_t lvar_vec_size=m_linkedvar_vec.size();
00864   int rv=TSV_OK;
00865 
00866   for (size_t vi=0;vi<lvar_vec_size;vi++) {
00867     TsvFileBinding* var=m_linkedvar_vec[vi];
00868     if (var!=NULL) {
00869       // These are sorted by frequency of use.
00870       if (var->m_ptr_int!=NULL) {
00871         rv=get(var->m_ptr_int);
00872       }
00873       else if (var->m_ptr_string!=NULL) {
00874         rv=get(var->m_ptr_string);
00875       }
00876       else if (var->m_ptr_float!=NULL) {
00877         rv=get(var->m_ptr_float);
00878       }
00879       else if (var->m_ptr_double!=NULL) {
00880         rv=get(var->m_ptr_double);
00881       }
00882       else if (var->m_ptr_uint!=NULL) {
00883         rv=get(var->m_ptr_uint);
00884       }
00885       else if (var->m_ptr_ulonglong!=NULL) {
00886         rv=get(var->m_ptr_ulonglong);
00887       }
00888       else {
00889         TSV_ERR_ABORT("internal error: Binding does not have a pointer!");
00890       }
00891       //
00892       if ((rv!=TSV_OK)&&(var->m_flags&TSV_BIND_REQUIRED)) {
00893         // We say "data line" to make it clear we arent counting header lines.
00894         std::string errmsg="Conversion error\n";
00895         errmsg+="TSVERROR: '"+tsvfile->m_fileName+"':"+ToStr(tsvfile->lineNumber()+1)+": ";
00896         errmsg+="Conversion of required field '"+m_cname+"'"+
00897           " to "+var->get_type_str()+
00898           " of '"+m_buffer+"' failed!\n";
00899         TSV_ERR_ABORT(errmsg);
00900       }
00901     }
00902   }
00903 }
00904 
00905 std::string
00906 affx::TsvFileField::get_bound_types_str()
00907 {
00908   std::string rv="";
00909   size_t lvar_vec_size=m_linkedvar_vec.size();
00910 
00911   for (size_t vi=0;vi<lvar_vec_size;vi++) {
00912     TsvFileBinding* var=m_linkedvar_vec[vi];
00913     if (var!=NULL) {
00914       // These are sorted by frequency of use.
00915       if (var->m_ptr_int!=NULL) {
00916         rv+="int,";
00917       }
00918       else if (var->m_ptr_string!=NULL) {
00919         rv+="string,";
00920       }
00921       else if (var->m_ptr_float!=NULL) {
00922         rv+="float,";
00923       }
00924       else if (var->m_ptr_double!=NULL) {
00925         rv+="double,";
00926       }
00927       else if (var->m_ptr_uint!=NULL) {
00928         rv+="uint,";
00929       }
00930       else if (var->m_ptr_ulonglong!=NULL) {
00931         rv+="longlong,";
00932       }
00933     }
00934   }
00935   // trim trailing ","
00936   if (rv!="") {
00937     rv.erase(rv.size()-1);
00938   }
00939   return rv;
00940 }
00941 
00942 /* Unused -- code which wants this generally uses <std::map>
00943 int
00944 affx::TsvFileField::setInternCacheSize(int size)
00945 {
00946   int old_size=m_interncache_size;
00947   // -1 means ignore this setting.
00948   if (size==TSV_INTERNSIZE_UNSET) {
00949     return old_size;
00950   }
00951   // Zero disables it, positive size enables it
00952   m_interncache_size=size;
00953   m_interncache_vec.reserve(size);
00954   if (size<(int)m_interncache_vec.size()) {
00955     // this is not random replacement but is quick.
00956     m_interncache_vec.resize(size);
00957   }
00958   //
00959   return old_size;
00960 }
00961 */

00988 void
00989 affx::TsvFileIndex::clear()
00990 {
00991   m_done=false;
00992   m_index_str2line.clear();
00993   m_index_int2line.clear();
00994   m_index_double2line.clear();
00995   m_index_uint2line.clear();
00996   m_index_ulonglong2line.clear();
00997 }
00998 
01002 void
01003 affx::TsvFileIndex::data_add(TsvFileField* field,linenum_t line)
01004 {
01005   APT_ERR_ASSERT(field!=NULL,"internal error: data_add: field is null.");
01006   //
01007   if (m_kind==TSV_INDEX_STRING) {
01008     // WARNING: field->m_buffer is reused and will be overwritten.
01009     // So we need to force a fresh copy to be made by modifying the string.
01010     // so first we "copy" the string.
01011     // std::string str_copy=field->m_buffer;
01012     // then we modify it -- this forces a copy
01013     // str_copy.append(1,' ');
01014     // then we undo the modification
01015     // str_copy.resize(str_copy.size()-1);
01016     // now we can use it in our map
01017     std::string str_copy;
01018     str_copy.append(field->m_buffer.begin(),field->m_buffer.end());
01019     m_index_str2line.insert(make_pair(str_copy,line));
01020     return;
01021   }
01022   if (m_kind==TSV_INDEX_INT) {
01023     int tmp_int;
01024     if (field->get(&tmp_int)==TSV_OK) {
01025       m_index_int2line.insert(make_pair(tmp_int,line));
01026     }
01027     return;
01028   }
01029   if (m_kind==TSV_INDEX_DOUBLE) {
01030     double tmp_double;
01031     if (field->get(&tmp_double)==TSV_OK) {
01032       m_index_double2line.insert(make_pair(tmp_double,line));
01033     }
01034     return;
01035   }
01036   if (m_kind==TSV_INDEX_UINT) {
01037     unsigned int tmp_uint;
01038     if (field->get(&tmp_uint)==TSV_OK) {
01039       m_index_uint2line.insert(make_pair(tmp_uint,line));
01040     }
01041     return;
01042   }
01043   if (m_kind==TSV_INDEX_ULONGLONG) {
01044     uint64_t tmp_ulonglong;
01045     if (field->get(&tmp_ulonglong)==TSV_OK) {
01046       m_index_ulonglong2line.insert(make_pair(tmp_ulonglong,line));
01047     }
01048     return;
01049   }
01050 }
01051 
01059 template<typename T1, typename linenum_t>
01060 int
01061 affx::TsvFileIndex::results_append_tmpl(std::vector<linenum_t>& results,
01062                                      std::multimap<T1,linenum_t>& mmap,
01063                                      int op,
01064                                      T1& val)
01065 {
01066   typename std::multimap<T1,linenum_t>::iterator r_start,r_end;
01067 
01068   if (op==TSV_OP_LT) {
01069     r_start=mmap.begin();
01070     r_end=mmap.lower_bound(val);
01071   }
01072   else if (op==TSV_OP_LTEQ) {
01073     r_start=mmap.begin();
01074     r_end=mmap.upper_bound(val);
01075   }
01076   else if (op==TSV_OP_EQ) {
01077     r_start=mmap.lower_bound(val);
01078     r_end=mmap.upper_bound(val);
01079   }
01080   else if (op==TSV_OP_GTEQ) {
01081     r_start=mmap.lower_bound(val);
01082     r_end=mmap.end();
01083   }
01084   else if (op==TSV_OP_GT) {
01085     r_start=mmap.upper_bound(val);
01086     r_end=mmap.end();
01087   } else {
01088     TSV_ERR_ABORT("Invalid operation in results_append. op="+ToStr(op));
01089     return TSV_ERR_UNKNOWN;
01090   }
01091 
01092   // Stick the range into find_result
01093   while (r_start!=r_end) {
01094     //printf("r_start=(%4d,%4d)\n",(*r_start).first,(int)(*r_start).second);
01095     results.push_back((*r_start).second);
01096     r_start++;
01097   }
01098   //
01099   return TSV_OK;;
01100 }
01101 
01107 int
01108 affx::TsvFileIndex::results_append(std::vector<linenum_t>& results,int op,std::string val)
01109 {
01110   // Use the template for the different types
01111   return results_append_tmpl(results,m_index_str2line,op,val);
01112 }
01118 int
01119 affx::TsvFileIndex::results_append(std::vector<linenum_t>& results,int op,int val)
01120 {
01121   return results_append_tmpl(results,m_index_int2line,op,val);
01122 }
01128 int
01129 affx::TsvFileIndex::results_append(std::vector<linenum_t>& results,int op,double val)
01130 {
01131   return results_append_tmpl(results,m_index_double2line,op,val);
01132 }
01138 int
01139 affx::TsvFileIndex::results_append(std::vector<linenum_t>& results,int op,unsigned int val)
01140 {
01141   return results_append_tmpl(results,m_index_uint2line,op,val);
01142 }
01148 int
01149 affx::TsvFileIndex::results_append(std::vector<linenum_t>& results,int op,uint64_t val)
01150 {
01151   return results_append_tmpl(results,m_index_ulonglong2line,op,val);
01152 }
01153 
01157 template<typename T1, typename linenum_t>
01158 void
01159 affx::TsvFileIndex::dump_map(std::multimap<T1,linenum_t>& mmap)
01160 {
01161   typename std::multimap<T1,linenum_t>::iterator i;
01162   int cnt=0;
01163   for (i=mmap.begin();i!=mmap.end();i++) {
01164     cout << cnt++ << " : '" << (*i).first << "' : '" << (*i).second << "'\n";
01165   }
01166 }
01167 
01169 void
01170 affx::TsvFileIndex::dump()
01171 {
01172   printf("index (clvl=%2d,cidx=%2d,kind=%2d) ==========\n",m_bindto_clvl,m_bindto_cidx,m_kind);
01173 
01174   if (m_kind==TSV_INDEX_STRING) {
01175     dump_map(m_index_str2line);
01176   }
01177   if (m_kind==TSV_INDEX_INT) {
01178     dump_map(m_index_int2line);
01179   }
01180   if (m_kind==TSV_INDEX_DOUBLE) {
01181     dump_map(m_index_double2line);
01182   }
01183   if (m_kind==TSV_INDEX_UINT) {
01184     dump_map(m_index_uint2line);
01185   }
01186   if (m_kind==TSV_INDEX_ULONGLONG) {
01187     dump_map(m_index_ulonglong2line);
01188   }
01189 }

01210 bool
01211 affx::TsvFileHeaderLine::operator<(const affx::TsvFileHeaderLine& b) const
01212 {
01213   if (m_order==b.m_order) {
01214     return (m_key<b.m_key);
01215   }
01216   return (m_order<b.m_order);
01217 }

01219 void
01220 affx::TsvFileHeaderLine::print()
01221 {
01222   if (m_key=="") {
01223     printf("#%s\n",m_value.c_str());
01224   }
01225   else {
01226     printf("#%%%s=%s\n",m_key.c_str(),m_value.c_str());
01227   }
01228 }
01229 
01230 
01232 bool
01233 affx::header_ptr_less(const affx::TsvFileHeaderLine* a,const affx::TsvFileHeaderLine* b)
01234 {
01235   // sort nulls to the end
01236   if ((a==NULL)&&(b==NULL)) {
01237     return false;
01238   }
01239   if (b==NULL) {
01240     return true;
01241   }
01242   if (a==NULL) {
01243     return false;
01244   }
01245 
01246   return ((*a)<(*b));
01247 }

01351 
01353 void
01354 affx::TsvFile::clear()
01355 {
01356   // close the file before zapping everything...
01357   close();
01358   // ...zap the filename
01359   m_fileName.clear();
01360 
01361   // dispose of all the bindings.
01362   clearBindings();
01363   // and the indexes
01364   clearIndexes();
01365   // and the headers
01366   clearHeaders();
01367 
01368   //
01369   m_lineLvl=0;
01370   m_lineNum=0;
01371   m_eof=false;
01372   m_index_done=false;
01373   // now get rid of the column info.
01374   m_column_map.clear();
01375   m_cnametocidx_map.clear();
01376 }
01377 
01379 void
01380 affx::TsvFile::clearBindings()
01381 {
01382   // clear the linked vars in the columns
01383   linkvars_clear();
01384   // release the memory of the vars
01385   for (unsigned int vi=0;vi<m_linkvars_vec.size();vi++) {
01386     delete m_linkvars_vec[vi];
01387   }
01388   // forget the pointers
01389   m_linkvars_vec.clear();
01390   // done because there arent any.
01391   m_linkvars_done=true;
01392 }
01393 
01395 void
01396 affx::TsvFile::clearIndexes()
01397 {
01398   for (unsigned int i=0;i<m_index_vec.size();i++) {
01399     if (m_index_vec[i]!=NULL) {
01400       m_index_vec[i]->clear();
01401       delete m_index_vec[i];
01402     }
01403   }
01404 }
01405 
01407 void
01408 affx::TsvFile::clearFields()
01409 {
01410   clearFieldsBelowClvl(0);
01411 }
01412 
01415 void
01416 affx::TsvFile::clearFieldsBelowClvl(int clvl_start)
01417 {
01418   assert(clvl_start>=0);
01419 
01420   unsigned int clvl_size=m_column_map.size();
01421   for (unsigned int clvl=clvl_start;clvl<clvl_size;clvl++) {
01422     unsigned int cidx_size=m_column_map[clvl].size();
01423     for (unsigned int cidx=0;cidx<cidx_size;cidx++) {
01424       m_column_map[clvl][cidx].clear();
01425       // dont zero out the linked vars -- while they should be zeroed,
01426       // it takes time.
01427       // m_column_map[clvl][cidx].linkedvars_assign();
01428     }
01429   }
01430 }

01451   return err;
01452 }

01498 
01501 bool
01502 affx::TsvFile::f_lookingat_eol()
01503 {
01504   int c;
01505   // the end of a file is the end of a line.
01506   if (!m_fileStream.good()) {
01507     return true;
01508   }
01509   //
01510   //c=m_fileStream.peek();
01511   c=M_PEEK();
01512   if (c==EOF) {
01513     return true;
01514   }
01515   if ((c==TSV_CHAR_CR)||(c==TSV_CHAR_LF)) {
01516     return true;
01517   }
01518   return false;
01519 }
01520 
01525 int
01526 affx::TsvFile::f_getline(std::string& line)
01527 {
01528   int c;
01529 
01530   line.clear();
01531   // we have some sort of error
01532   if (!m_fileStream.good()) {
01533     return (TSV_ERR_FILEIO);
01534   }
01535 
01536   while (1) {
01537     // get a char...
01538     //c=m_fileStream.get();
01539     c=M_GETC();
01540     // eof?
01541     if ((c==TSV_CHAR_EOF)||!m_fileStream.good()) {
01542       break;
01543     }
01544     // LF ends a line
01545     if (c==TSV_CHAR_LF) {
01546       break;
01547     }
01548     // CR ends a line too.
01549     if (c==TSV_CHAR_CR) {
01550       // c=m_fileStream.peek();
01551       c=M_PEEK();
01552       // CR could be followed by a LF
01553       if (c==TSV_CHAR_LF) {
01554         //c=m_fileStream.get();
01555         c=M_GETC();
01556         break;
01557       }
01558     }
01559     // push it on
01560     line.append(1,(char)c);
01561   }
01562   //
01563   return TSV_OK;
01564 }
01565 
01566 
01567 
01569 
01571 void
01572 affx::TsvFile::clearHeaders()
01573 {
01574   m_headers_bykey.clear();
01575   //
01576   int v_size=(int)m_headers_vec.size();
01577   for (int vi=0;vi<v_size;vi++) {
01578     delete m_headers_vec[vi];
01579     m_headers_vec[vi]=NULL;
01580   }
01581   //
01582   m_headers_vec.clear();
01583   m_headers_vec_packed=true;
01584   // clear these too...
01585   headersBegin();
01586 }
01587 
01590 void
01591 affx::TsvFile::headersBegin()
01592 {
01593   resortHeaders();
01594   m_headers_idx=0;
01595   m_headers_iter=m_headers_bykey.begin();
01596   m_headers_curptr=NULL;
01597   m_headers_curkey_string="";
01598 }
01599 
01601 TsvFileHeaderLine*
01602 affx::TsvFile::nextHeaderPtr()
01603 {
01604   while (m_headers_idx<(int)m_headers_vec.size()) {
01605     m_headers_curptr=m_headers_vec[m_headers_idx++];
01606     if (m_headers_curptr!=NULL) {
01607       return m_headers_curptr;
01608     }
01609   }
01610   m_headers_curptr=NULL;
01611   return m_headers_curptr;
01612 }
01613 
01618 int
01619 affx::TsvFile::headersFindNext(const std::string& key,std::string& val)
01620 {
01621   // if the key is different that the last, do an implicit begin
01622   if (key!=m_headers_curkey_string) {
01623     headersBegin();
01624     m_headers_curkey_string=key;
01625     m_headers_iter=m_headers_bykey.lower_bound(key);
01626   }
01627 
01628   // past the end of matching keys?
01629   if ((m_headers_iter==m_headers_bykey.end())||(m_headers_iter->first!=key)) {
01630     return TSV_HEADER_LAST;
01631   }
01632 
01633   // what we are returning...
01634   val=m_headers_iter->second->m_value;
01635   // point to the next one...
01636   m_headers_iter++;
01637   return TSV_OK;
01638 }
01639 
01644 int
01645 affx::TsvFile::headersNext(std::string& key,std::string& val)
01646 {
01647   // skip comment headers
01648   do {
01649     nextHeaderPtr();
01650     if (m_headers_curptr==NULL) {
01651       return TSV_HEADER_LAST;
01652     }
01653   } while (m_headers_curptr->m_key=="");
01654 
01655   key=m_headers_curptr->m_key;
01656   val=m_headers_curptr->m_value;
01657 
01658   // headers next should never return an empty key.
01659   assert(key!="");
01660 
01661   return TSV_OK;
01662 }
01663 
01666 int
01667 affx::TsvFile::headersCount()
01668 {
01669   // test here to save a method call.
01670   if (m_headers_vec_packed==false) {
01671     repackHeaders();
01672   }
01673   return (int)m_headers_vec.size();
01674 }
01675 
01679 int
01680 affx::TsvFile::headerKeyLegal(const std::string& key)
01681 {
01682   // We dont allow '=' in the key
01683   if (key.find('=')!=std::string::npos) {
01684     return (TSV_ERR_FORMAT);
01685   }
01686   // Nor do we allow headers which start with "header" -- they are reserved
01687   if ((key.size()==(m_headName.length()+1))&&(key.find(m_headName)==0)) {
01688     return (TSV_ERR_FORMAT);
01689   }
01690   // if not rejected it is ok...
01691   return TSV_OK;
01692 }
01693 
01698 int
01699 affx::TsvFile::addHeader(const std::string& key,const std::string& val)
01700 {
01701   // should a copy be done here?
01702   // might that be the source of the windows problems?
01703   return addHeader(key,val,(int)m_headers_vec.size());
01704 }
01705 
01711 int
01712 affx::TsvFile::addHeader(const std::string& key,const std::string& val,int order)
01713 {
01714   int rv;
01715   if ((rv=headerKeyLegal(key))!=TSV_OK) {
01716     return rv;
01717   }
01718   return addHeader_nocheck(key,val,order);
01719 }
01720 
01725 int
01726 affx::TsvFile::addHeader(const std::string& key,int val)
01727 {
01728   // cast to a string and add it.
01729   std::ostringstream stream;
01730   stream << val;
01731   addHeader(key,stream.str());
01732   return TSV_OK;
01733 }

01740 affx::TsvFile::addHeader(const std::string& key,double val)

01742   // cast to a string and add it.
01743   std::ostringstream stream;
01744   stream << val;
01745   addHeader(key,stream.str());
01746   return TSV_OK;
01747 }

01755 {
01756   for (int i=0;i<val.size();i++) {
01757     addHeader(key,val[i]);
01758   }
01759   return TSV_OK;

01779   return addHeader_nocheck("",comment,(int)m_headers_vec.size());
01780 }

01786 int
01787 affx::TsvFile::addHeader_nocheck(const std::string& key,const std::string& val)
01788 {

01790 }
01791 
01795 int
01796 affx::TsvFile::writeFileComment(const std::string& comment)
01797 {
01798   if (!m_fileStream.good()) {
01799     TSV_ERR_ABORT("File is not writeable.");
01800   }
01801   m_fileStream << TSV_STRING_COMMENT << comment << m_optEndl;
01802   //
01803   return TSV_OK;
01804 }
01805 
01811 int
01812 affx::TsvFile::addHeader_nocheck(const std::string& key,const std::string& val,int order)
01813 {
01814   TsvFileHeaderLine* hdrptr=new TsvFileHeaderLine(key,val,order);
01815   //
01816   m_headers_vec.push_back(hdrptr);
01817   m_headers_bykey.insert(make_pair(key,hdrptr));
01818   return TSV_OK;
01819 }
01820 
01825 int
01826 affx::TsvFile::addHeadersFrom(affx::TsvFile& f_tsv,int flags)
01827 {
01828   return addHeadersFrom(f_tsv,"",flags);
01829 }
01830 
01836 int
01837 affx::TsvFile::addHeadersFrom(affx::TsvFile& f_tsv,const std::string& prefix,int flags)
01838 {
01839   string key;
01840   string val;
01841 
01842   f_tsv.headersBegin();
01843   while (f_tsv.headersNext(key,val)==TSV_OK) {
01844     if (key=="") {
01845       if ((flags&TSV_ADD_COMMENTS)!=0) {
01846         addHeaderComment(val);
01847       }
01848     } else {
01849       if ((flags&TSV_ADD_KEYS)!=0) {
01850         addHeader(prefix+key,val);
01851       }
01852     }
01853   }
01854   return TSV_OK;
01855 }
01856 
01862 int
01863 affx::TsvFile::addHeadersFrom(affx::TsvFile& f_tsv,
01864                               const std::string& prefix,
01865                               std::vector<std::string>& key_vec)
01866 {
01867   string val;
01868 
01869   for (int i=0;i<(int)key_vec.size();i++) {
01870     if (f_tsv.getHeader(key_vec[i],val)==TSV_OK) {
01871       addHeader(prefix+key_vec[i],val);
01872     }
01873   }
01874   return TSV_OK;
01875 }
01876 
01879 int
01880 affx::TsvFile::headerCount()
01881 {
01882   repackHeaders(); // this removes null ptrs so headerCount==size()
01883   return m_headers_vec.size();
01884 }
01885 
01890 int
01891 affx::TsvFile::getHeader(const std::string& key,std::string& val)
01892 {
01893   m_headers_iter=m_headers_bykey.find(key);
01894   if (m_headers_iter==m_headers_bykey.end()) {
01895     return TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND;
01896   }
01897   val=(*m_headers_iter).second->m_value;
01898   return TSV_OK;
01899 }
01900 
01905 int
01906 affx::TsvFile::getHeader(const std::string& key,int& val)
01907 {
01908   std::string tmp_str;
01909   int tmp_val;
01910   const char* str_in;
01911   char* str_out;
01912 
01913   if (getHeader(key,tmp_str)==TSV_OK) {
01914     str_in=tmp_str.c_str();
01915     tmp_val=strtol(str_in,&str_out,0);
01916     if (str_in==str_out) {
01917       return TSV_ERR_FORMAT;
01918     }
01919     val=tmp_val;
01920     return TSV_OK;
01921   }
01922   return TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND;
01923 }
01924 
01929 int
01930 affx::TsvFile::getHeader(const std::string& key,double& val)
01931 {
01932   std::string tmp_str;
01933   double tmp_val;
01934   const char* str_in;
01935   char* str_out;
01936 
01937   if (getHeader(key,tmp_str)==TSV_OK) {
01938     str_in=tmp_str.c_str();
01939     tmp_val=strtod(str_in,&str_out);
01940     if (str_in==str_out) {
01941       return TSV_ERR_FORMAT;
01942     }
01943     val=tmp_val;
01944     return TSV_OK;
01945   }
01946   return TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND;
01947 }
01948 
01949 int
01950 affx::TsvFile::getHeader(const std::string& key,std::vector<std::string>& val)
01951 {
01952   val.clear();
01953   return getHeaderAppend(key,val);
01954 }
01955 
01956 int
01957 affx::TsvFile::getHeaderAppend(const std::string& key,std::vector<std::string>& val)
01958 {
01959   affx::TsvFile::header_iter_t i;
01960   for (i=m_headers_bykey.find(key);(i!=m_headers_bykey.end())&&(i->first==key);i++) {
01961     val.push_back(i->second->m_value);
01962   }
01963   // didnt find any.
01964   if (val.size()==0) {
01965     return TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND;
01966   }
01967   return affx::TSV_OK;
01968 }
01969 
01975 int
01976 affx::TsvFile::hasHeaderEqualTo(const std::string& key,const std::string& val)
01977 {
01978   // printf("hasHeaderEqualTo('%s','%s')\n",key.c_str(),val.c_str());
01979   // scan the headers.
01980   affx::TsvFile::header_iter_t i;
01981   for (i=m_headers_bykey.find(key);(i!=m_headers_bykey.end())&&(i->first==key);i++) {
01982     // printf("hasHeaderEqualTo: check '%s'/'%s')\n",i->first.c_str(),i->second->m_value.c_str());
01983     if (i->second->m_value==val) {
01984       return TSV_OK;
01985     }
01986   }
01987   // didnt find it.
01988   return TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND;
01989 }
01990 
01991 void
01992 affx::TsvFile::repackHeaders()
01993 {
01994   if (m_headers_vec_packed==true) {
01995     return;
01996   }
01997 
01998   //
01999   std::vector<affx::TsvFileHeaderLine*> tmp_vec;
02000   std::vector<affx::TsvFileHeaderLine*>::iterator i;
02001 
02002   // save the non-null ones...
02003   for (i=m_headers_vec.begin();i!=m_headers_vec.end();i++) {
02004     if (*i!=NULL) {
02005       tmp_vec.push_back(*i);
02006     }
02007   }
02008   // ...and put them back.
02009   m_headers_vec=tmp_vec;
02010   // we are packed
02011   m_headers_vec_packed=true;
02012 }
02013 
02014 
02016 void
02017 affx::TsvFile::resortHeaders()
02018 {
02019   //
02020   repackHeaders();
02021   // put headers in order
02022   sort(m_headers_vec.begin(),m_headers_vec.end(),affx::header_ptr_less);
02023 }
02024 
02028 
02029 int
02030 affx::TsvFile::deleteHeaders(const std::string& key)
02031 {
02032   int v_size=(int)m_headers_vec.size();
02033   for (int vi=0;vi<v_size;vi++) {
02034     if ((m_headers_vec[vi]!=NULL) && (m_headers_vec[vi]->m_key==key)) {
02035       deleteHeaderPtr(m_headers_vec[vi]);
02036     }
02037   }
02038   return affx::TSV_OK;
02039 }
02040 
02041 int
02042 affx::TsvFile::deleteHeaders(const std::vector<std::string>& keys)
02043 {
02044   for (int i=0;i<keys.size();i++) {
02045     deleteHeaders(keys[i]);
02046   }
02047   return affx::TSV_OK;
02048 }
02049 
02050 int
02051 affx::TsvFile::deleteHeaders(const char**  keys)
02052 {
02053   if (keys!=NULL) {
02054     for (int i=0;keys[i]!=NULL;i++) {
02055       deleteHeaders(keys[i]);
02056     }
02057   }
02058   return affx::TSV_OK;
02059 }
02060 
02064 int
02065 affx::TsvFile::deleteHeaderPtr(affx::TsvFileHeaderLine* hdrptr)
02066 {
02067   // skip if done...
02068   if (hdrptr==NULL) {
02069     return TSV_OK;
02070   }
02071 
02072   // find the header ptrs in the map and erase them
02073   affx::TsvFile::header_iter_t mi;
02074   // Goto is an ugly hag to work around win32 stl bug
02075   START_DEL_HEADER_PTR:
02076   for (mi=m_headers_bykey.begin();mi!=m_headers_bykey.end();mi++) {
02077     if (mi->second==hdrptr) {
02078       m_headers_bykey.erase(mi);
02079       goto START_DEL_HEADER_PTR;
02080     }
02081   }
02082   // erase it from the vector, dont resize it.
02083   int find_cnt=0;
02084   int v_size=(int)m_headers_vec.size();
02085   for (int vi=0;vi<v_size;vi++) {
02086     if (m_headers_vec[vi]==hdrptr) {
02087       m_headers_vec[vi]=NULL;
02088       find_cnt++;
02089     }
02090   }
02091   // delete the pointer if it was found in the list.
02092   if (find_cnt>0) {
02093     m_headers_vec_packed=false;
02094     delete hdrptr;
02095     return TSV_OK;
02096   }
02097 
02098   // didnt find it in the list.
02099   return TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND;
02100 }
02101 
02103 
02107 int
02108 affx::TsvFile::f_read_header_v1()
02109 {
02110   int rv;
02111   std::string line;
02112   std::vector<std::string> colname_vec;
02113 
02114   if ((rv=f_getline(line))!=TSV_OK) {
02115     return rv;
02116   }
02117 
02118   // Try and sense what the fieldsep is?
02119   if (m_optAutoSenseSep==true) {
02120     // split on each
02121     std::vector<std::string> colname_tab_vec;
02122     splitstr(line,'\t',colname_tab_vec);
02123     std::vector<std::string> colname_comma_vec;
02124     splitstr(line,',',colname_comma_vec);
02125     //printf("auto: c=%d t=%d ",colname_comma_vec.size(),colname_tab_vec.size());
02126     // Dont autosense if there are both separators present.
02127     if ((colname_tab_vec.size()==1)&&(colname_comma_vec.size()>0)) {
02128       m_optFieldSep=',';
02129     }
02130     if ((colname_comma_vec.size()==1)&&(colname_tab_vec.size()>0)) {
02131       m_optFieldSep='\t';
02132     }
02133   }
02134 
02135   // set the columns
02136   splitstr(line,m_optFieldSep,colname_vec);
02137   for (unsigned int col=0;col<colname_vec.size();col++) {
02138     // discard quotes?
02139     if (m_optAutoDequote==true) {
02140       dequote(colname_vec[col]);
02141     }
02142     //
02143     defineColumn(0,col,colname_vec[col]);
02144   }
02145   return TSV_OK;
02146 }
02147 
02149 int
02150 affx::TsvFile::f_read_header_v2()
02151 {
02152   int rv;
02153   fstream::pos_type f_start;
02154   string line;
02155 
02156   f_start=m_fileStream.tellg();
02157 
02158   if ((rv=f_getline(line))!=TSV_OK) {
02159     return rv;
02160   }
02161 
02162   // printf("header: %s\n",line.c_str());
02163 
02164   ltrim(line);
02165   // "#%" An actual header line
02166   if (line.find("#%")==0) {
02167     string::size_type pos_equal=line.find("=");
02168     if (pos_equal!=string::npos) {
02169       string key(line,2,pos_equal-2);
02170       string val(line,pos_equal+1);
02171       trim(key);
02172       rtrim(val);
02173       // printf("key=%-20s val=%s\n",key.c_str(),val.c_str());
02174       addHeader_nocheck(key,val);
02175       return TSV_HEADER;
02176     }
02177     // should print a warning.
02178     return (TSV_ERR_FORMAT);
02179   }
02180   // skip the comment
02181   if (line.find("#")==0) {
02182     addHeaderComment(string(line,1));
02183     return TSV_HEADER;
02184   }
02185 
02186   // not a header line - skip back to start of line to read as data
02187   m_fileStream.seekg(f_start);
02188   return TSV_HEADER_LAST;
02189 }
02190 
02193 int
02194 affx::TsvFile::f_read_headers()
02195 {
02196   // skip to start of file.
02197   m_fileStream.seekg(0);
02198 
02199   // suck in all the v2 headers
02200   while (f_read_header_v2()==TSV_HEADER) {
02201     // null body
02202   }
02203 
02204   //dump_headers();
02205 
02206   // If we dont have any headers at all, then the first line has the header
02207   // read its header line.
02208   std::string ignored;
02209   if (getHeader(m_headName+"0",ignored)!=TSV_OK) {
02210     if (m_optHasColumnHeader==true) {
02211       m_fileFormat=TSV_FORMAT_V1;
02212       f_read_header_v1();
02213     } else {
02214       m_fileFormat=TSV_FORMAT_TABLE;
02215     }
02216   } else {
02217     m_fileFormat=TSV_FORMAT_V2;
02218     headers_to_fields_v2();
02219   }
02220 
02221   // The rest of the file is data.
02222   m_fileDataPos=m_fileStream.tellg();
02223   // sets line counters
02224   rewind();
02225 
02226   //dump_bindings();
02227   return TSV_OK;
02228 }
02229 
02231 void
02232 affx::TsvFile::headers_to_fields_v2()
02233 {
02234   // now set up mappings
02235   for (unsigned int clvl=0;clvl<9;clvl++) {
02236     string head_name=m_headName;
02237     head_name.append(1,(char)('0'+clvl)); // +"num"
02238     affx::TsvFile::header_iter_t i=m_headers_bykey.find(head_name);
02239     if (i!=m_headers_bykey.end()) {
02241       vector<string> colname_vec;
02242       splitstr(i->second->m_value,m_optFieldSep,colname_vec);
02243       for (unsigned int col=0;col<colname_vec.size();col++) {
02244         if (col<clvl) {
02245           if (colname_vec[col]!="") {
02246             Verbose::out(1, "==Warning: level=" + ToStr(clvl) + " col=" + ToStr(col) +
02247                          " name=" + colname_vec[col] +" not indended correctly==");
02248 //             printf("==Warning: level=%d col=%d name='%s' not indended correctly\n",
02249 //                    clvl,col,colname_vec[col].c_str());
02250           }
02251         } else {
02252           defineColumn(clvl,col-clvl,colname_vec[col]);
02253         }
02254       }
02255     }
02256   }
02257 }
02258 
02260 
02261 
02268 int affx::TsvFile::defineColumn(int clvl,int cidx,const std::string& cname)
02269 {
02270   return defineColumn(clvl,cidx,cname,TSV_TYPE_UNKNOWN);
02271 }
02272 
02278 
02279 
02280 int
02281 affx::TsvFile::defineColumn(int clvl,int cidx,const std::string& cname,tsv_type_t ctype)
02282 {
02283   if (clvl<0) {
02284     return (TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND);
02285   }
02286   //printf("colname_set(%d,'%s',%d)\n",clvl,cname.c_str(),cidx); //
02287   if (clvl>=(int)m_column_map.size()) {
02288     // plus one as we are going to use 'clvl' as an index...
02289     m_column_map.resize(clvl+1);
02290     m_cnametocidx_map.resize(clvl+1);
02291   }
02292   // expand the width if needed.
02293   if (cidx>=(int)m_column_map[clvl].size()) {
02294     m_column_map[clvl].resize(cidx+1);
02295   }
02296   // record info about this column
02297   m_column_map[clvl][cidx].m_clvl=clvl;
02298   m_column_map[clvl][cidx].m_cidx=cidx;
02299   m_column_map[clvl][cidx].m_cname=cname;
02300   m_column_map[clvl][cidx].m_ctype=ctype;
02301   // map column name to column idx
02302   m_cnametocidx_map[clvl][cname]=cidx;
02303 
02304   // default precision if set
02305   if (m_optPrecision>=0) {
02306     m_column_map[clvl][cidx].setPrecision(m_optPrecision);
02307   }
02308 
02309   return (TSV_OK);
02310 }
02311 
02316 int
02317 affx::TsvFile::cname2cidx(int clvl,const std::string& cname)
02318 {
02319   if ((clvl<0)||(clvl>=(int)m_column_map.size())) {
02320     return TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND;
02321   }
02322   map<string,int>::iterator i;
02323   i=m_cnametocidx_map[clvl].find(cname);
02324   if (i==m_cnametocidx_map[clvl].end()) {
02325     return TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND;
02326   }
02327   return ((*i).second);
02328 }
02329 
02330 #define CNAME_FIND(name) { int rv; rv=cname2cidx(clvl,name); if (rv>=0) { return rv; } }
02331 
02337 int
02338 affx::TsvFile::cname2cidx(int clvl,const std::string& alias1,const std::string& alias2)
02339 {
02340   CNAME_FIND(alias1);
02341   CNAME_FIND(alias2);
02342   return TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND;
02343 }
02350 int
02351 affx::TsvFile::cname2cidx(int clvl,const std::string& alias1,const std::string& alias2,const std::string& alias3)
02352 {
02353   CNAME_FIND(alias1);
02354   CNAME_FIND(alias2);
02355   CNAME_FIND(alias3);
02356   return TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND;
02357 }
02365 int
02366 affx::TsvFile::cname2cidx(int clvl,const std::string& alias1,const std::string& alias2,const std::string& alias3,const std::string& alias4)
02367 {
02368   CNAME_FIND(alias1);
02369   CNAME_FIND(alias2);
02370   CNAME_FIND(alias3);
02371   CNAME_FIND(alias4);
02372   return TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND;
02373 }
02374

02381 int
02382 affx::TsvFile::cname2cidx(int clvl,int cidx)

02384   if ((clvl<0)||(clvl>=(int)m_column_map.size())) {
02385     return TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND;

02391 
02396 TsvFileField*
02397 affx::TsvFile::clvlcidx2colptr(int clvl,int cidx) {
02398   if ((clvl<0)||
02399       (clvl>=(int)m_column_map.size())||
02400       (cidx<0)||
02401       (cidx>=(int)m_column_map[clvl].size())) {
02402     return NULL;
02403   }
02404   return &m_column_map[clvl][cidx];
02405 }
02406 
02411 TsvFileField*
02412 affx::TsvFile::clvlcidx2colptr(int clvl,const std::string& cname) {
02413   return clvlcidx2colptr(clvl,cname2cidx(clvl,cname));
02414 }
02415 
02421 int
02422 affx::TsvFile::cidx2cname(int clvl,int cidx,std::string& cname)
02423 {
02424   TsvFileField* colptr=clvlcidx2colptr(clvl,cidx);
02425   if (colptr==NULL) {
02426     return (TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND);
02427   }
02428   cname=colptr->m_cname;
02429   return TSV_OK;
02430 }
02431 
02432 std::string
02433 affx::TsvFile::getColumnName(int clvl,int cidx)
02434 {
02435   std::string cname;
02436   cidx2cname(clvl,cidx,cname);
02437   return cname;
02438 }
02439 
02440 int
02441 affx::TsvFile::setPrecision(int clvl,int cidx,int places)
02442 {
02443   TsvFileField* colptr=clvlcidx2colptr(clvl,cidx);
02444   if (colptr==NULL) {
02445     return (TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND);
02446   }
02447   return colptr->setPrecision(places);
02448 }
02449 
02450 int
02451 affx::TsvFile::setPrecision(int clvl,const std::string& cname,int places)
02452 {
02453   return setPrecision(clvl,cname2cidx(clvl,cname),places);
02454 }
02455 
02457 
02461 int
02462 affx::TsvFile::open(const std::string& fname)
02463 {
02464   int rv;
02465 
02466   close();
02467 
02468   // remeber the name
02469   m_fileName=fname;
02470   //
02471   if (m_fileName.empty()) {
02472     TSV_ERR_ABORT("Cant open an empty filename. (filename='"+fname+"')");
02473   }
02474 
02475   // clear before opening -- errors are sticky.
02476   m_fileStream.clear();
02477   // hello?!?
02478   m_fileStream.open(Util::convertPathName(m_fileName).c_str(),std::fstream::in|std::fstream::binary);
02479   // Check an error opening the file.
02480   if(!m_fileStream.is_open() || !m_fileStream.good()) {
02481     if (m_optAbortOnError) {
02482       TSV_ERR_ABORT("open: Could not open file: '" + Util::convertPathName(m_fileName) + "' to read.");
02483     }
02484     else {
02485       return (TSV_ERR_FILEIO);
02486     }
02487   }
02488 
02489   // now throw an exception if something really bad happens.
02490   m_fileStream.exceptions(ios_base::badbit|ios_base::failbit);
02491 
02492 #ifdef TSV_USE_RDBUF
02493   // This appears to be faster than calling ".get()"
02494   m_rdbuf=m_fileStream.rdbuf();
02495 #endif
02496 
02497   //printf("### opening: '%s' (rdstate=%4d,%s)...\n",
02498   //       m_fileName.c_str(),
02499   //       m_fileStream.rdstate(),
02500   //       (m_fileStream.good()?"good":"not good"));
02501   //file_buf=m_fileStream.rdbuf();
02502   if (!m_fileStream.good()) {
02503     return (TSV_ERR_FILEIO);
02504   }
02505 
02506   // parse the headers
02507   f_read_headers();
02508 
02509   // establish the links
02510   if (m_optLinkVarsOnOpen) {
02511     rv=formatOk();
02512     if (rv!=TSV_OK) {
02513       Verbose::out(1, "TSV: warning: '" + fname + "': bad format (=" + ToStr(rv) + ")");
02514       //    printf("TSV: warning: '%s': bad format (=%d)\n",fname.c_str(),rv);
02515     }
02516   }
02517 
02518   // redudant with above?
02519   linkvars_maybe();
02520 
02521   return TSV_OK;
02522 }
02523 
02524 
02528 int
02529 affx::TsvFile::openTable(const std::string& fname)
02530 {
02531   m_optHasColumnHeader=false;
02532   m_optAutoColumns=true;
02533   //
02534   return open(fname);
02535 }
02536 
02540 int
02541 affx::TsvFile::openCsv(const std::string& fname)
02542 {
02543   m_optAutoColumns=true;
02544   m_optAutoDequote=true;
02545   m_optAutoSenseSep=false; // must be ','
02546   m_optEscapeChar='\\';    // The escape char is '\'
02547   m_optEscapeOk=true;
02548   m_optFieldSep=',';       // set the field sep char
02549   m_optHasColumnHeader=true;
02550   //
02551   return open(fname);
02552 }

02556 int
02557 affx::TsvFile::close()
02558 {
02559   // close an open stream
02560   if (m_fileStream.is_open()) {
02561     m_fileStream.close();
02562   }
02563   return TSV_OK;
02564 }
02565 
02569 void
02570 affx::TsvFile::flush()
02571 {
02572   if (m_fileStream.is_open()) {
02573     m_fileStream.flush();
02574   }
02575 }
02576 
02579 int
02580 affx::TsvFile::f_advance_tabs()
02581 {
02582   int c;
02583   int tabcnt=0;
02584   int maxtabs=(int)(m_column_map.size()-1);
02585 
02586   m_line_fpos=m_fileStream.tellg();
02587 
02588   // first nibble off expected tabs...
02589   while (tabcnt<maxtabs) {
02590     //c=m_fileStream.get();
02591     c=M_GETC();
02592     // printf("!%c",c);
02593     if (c==TSV_CHAR_TAB) {
02594       tabcnt++;
02595     }
02596     else if (c==TSV_CHAR_COMMENT) {
02597       //m_fileStream.putback((char)c);
02598       if(tabcnt > 0) {
02599         TSV_ERR_ABORT("Error in: '" + m_fileName + "'" +
02600                       " at line " + ToStr(m_lineNum) + ":" +
02601                       " Not allowed to have comment characters except on first character of line.");
02602       }
02603       M_UNGETC(c);
02604       return TSV_LINE_COMMENT;
02605     }
02606     else if ((c==TSV_CHAR_CR)||(c==TSV_CHAR_LF)) {
02607       //m_fileStream.putback((char)c);
02608       M_UNGETC(c);
02609       return (TSV_LINE_BLANK);
02610     }
02611     else {
02612       // m_fileStream.putback((char)c);
02613       M_UNGETC(c);
02614       break;
02615     }
02616   }
02617 
02618   // skip possibly extra whitespace
02619   //c=m_fileStream.peek();
02620   c=M_PEEK();
02621   if (c==TSV_CHAR_COMMENT) {
02622     return (TSV_LINE_COMMENT);
02623   }
02624   if ((c==TSV_CHAR_CR)||(c==TSV_CHAR_LF)||(c==EOF)) {
02625     return (TSV_LINE_BLANK);
02626   }
02627 
02628   if ((c==TSV_CHAR_SPACE)||(c==TSV_CHAR_TAB)) {
02629     std::fstream::pos_type skipstart;
02630     int spaceCnt = -1;
02631     skipstart=m_fileStream.tellg();
02632     //
02633     do {
02634       //c=m_fileStream.get();
02635       c=M_GETC();
02636       spaceCnt++;
02637     } while ((c==TSV_CHAR_SPACE)||(c==TSV_CHAR_TAB));
02638     // what are we looking at now?
02639     if (c==TSV_CHAR_COMMENT) {
02640       //m_fileStream.putback(c);
02641       if(spaceCnt > 0) {
02642         TSV_ERR_ABORT("Error in: " + m_fileName + " at line: " + ToStr(m_lineNum) + "."
02643                       " Not allowed to have comment characters except on first character of line.");
02644       }
02645       M_UNGETC(c);
02646       return (TSV_LINE_COMMENT);
02647     }
02648     if ((c==TSV_CHAR_CR)||(c==TSV_CHAR_LF)||(c==EOF)) {
02649       //m_fileStream.putback(c);
02650       M_UNGETC(c);
02651       return (TSV_LINE_BLANK);
02652     }
02653     // found a normal char, rewind to start of skip
02654     m_fileStream.seekg(skipstart);
02655   }
02656 
02657   return tabcnt;
02658 }
02659 
02663 int
02664 affx::TsvFile::f_advance_eol()
02665 {
02666   int charcnt=0;
02667   int c;
02668 
02669   if (!m_fileStream.good()) {
02670     return (TSV_ERR_FILEIO);
02671   }
02672 
02674   while (1) {
02675     // get a char...
02676     // c=m_fileStream.get();
02677     c=M_GETC();
02678     // eof?
02679     //if (!m_fileStream.good()) {
02680     //  break;
02681     //}
02682     if (c==EOF) {
02683       break;
02684     }
02685     // LF ends a line
02686     if (c==TSV_CHAR_LF) {
02687       break;
02688     }
02689     // CR ends a line too.
02690     if (c==TSV_CHAR_CR) {
02691       //c=m_fileStream.peek();
02692       c=M_PEEK();
02693       // CR could be followed by a LF
02694       if (c==TSV_CHAR_LF) {
02695         //c=m_fileStream.get();
02696         c=M_GETC();
02697         break;
02698       }
02699     }
02700     // count the chars
02701     charcnt++;
02702   }
02703 
02704   // we just went forward a line
02705   m_lineNum++;
02706 
02707   //
02708   return charcnt;
02709 }
02710 
02711 
02717 int
02718 affx::TsvFile::f_read_column(TsvFileField* col)
02719 {
02720   int c;
02721   //char* buf_ptr;
02722   //int   buf_len;
02723   int   bi;
02724   bool  finished;
02725   char  in_quotes;
02726 
02727   //
02728   assert(col!=NULL);
02729   // mark this column as being null.
02730   col->m_isnull=true;
02731   col->m_value_int_done=false;
02732   col->m_value_double_done=false;
02733   col->m_value_uint_done=false;
02734   col->m_value_ulonglong_done=false;
02735 
02736   // Nothing to be read.
02737   if (!m_fileStream.good()) {
02738     col->m_buffer="";
02739     return (TSV_ERR_FILEIO);
02740   }
02741 
02742   // Mark it as not being null.
02743   col->m_isnull=false;
02744 
02745   // set when the field is finished being read.
02746   finished=false;
02747   in_quotes=0;
02748 
02749   // The common case is the field is the same size as last time.
02750   // Copy the chars into an already existing string.
02751   bi=0;
02752   col->m_buffer.resize(0);
02753   while (1) {
02754     //c=m_fileStream.get();
02755     c=M_GETC();
02756 
02757     //
02758     if ((m_optEscapeChar==c)&&(m_optEscapeOk==true)) {
02759       //c=m_fileStream.get();
02760       c=M_GETC();
02761       c=unescapeChar(c);
02762     }
02763     // start or end of quotes?
02764     else if (((c==m_optQuoteChar1)&&(m_optQuoteChar1!=0))||
02765              ((c==m_optQuoteChar2)&&(m_optQuoteChar2!=0)))
02766       {
02767         if (in_quotes==0) { // open
02768           in_quotes=c;
02769         }
02770         else if (c==in_quotes) { // close
02771           in_quotes=0;
02772         }
02773       }
02774     else if ((m_optFieldSep==c)&&(in_quotes==0)) {
02775       col->m_buffer.resize(bi); // trunc the buffer to size.
02776       break; // discard the field-sep-char
02777     }
02778     // end of field? (short value)
02779     else if ((c==TSV_CHAR_CR)||(c==TSV_CHAR_LF)) {
02780       //m_fileStream.putback(c); // leave eol char
02781       M_UNGETC(c);
02782       col->m_buffer.resize(bi); // trunc
02783       break;
02784     }
02785     // ran out of data
02786     else if (c==EOF) {
02787       if (bi==0) {
02788         col->m_isnull=true; // revise our opinion about this being non-null
02789       }
02790       col->m_buffer.resize(bi);
02791       return (TSV_ERR_FILEIO);
02792     }
02793 
02794     // add to our buffer
02795     col->m_buffer.append(1,(char)c); // buffer full, append
02796     bi++;
02797   }
02798 
02799   // dequote the column?
02800   if (col->m_optAutoDequote==true) {
02801     trim(col->m_buffer);
02802     dequote(col->m_buffer);
02803   }
02804 
02805   //printf("z\n"); fflush(NULL);
02806   return TSV_OK;
02807 }
02808 
02812 int
02813 affx::TsvFile::f_read_columns(int line_clvl)
02814 {
02815   assert(line_clvl>=0);
02816 
02817   //clearFieldsBelowClvl(line_clvl+1); // profiling
02818 
02819   if (line_clvl<(int)m_column_map.size()) {
02820     unsigned int cidx_size=m_column_map[line_clvl].size();
02821     for (unsigned int cidx=0;cidx<cidx_size;cidx++) {
02822       f_read_column(&m_column_map[line_clvl][cidx]);
02823       m_column_map[line_clvl][cidx].linkedvars_assign(this);
02824       //printf("C:'%s'\n",m_column_map[line_clvl][cidx].buffer.c_str());
02825     }
02826   }
02827 
02828   // Read more columns?
02829   if (m_optAutoColumns) {
02830     //char colname_buf[100];
02831     while (!f_lookingat_eol()) {
02832       int cidx=getColumnCount(line_clvl);
02833       // create a column
02834       std::ostringstream stream;
02835       stream << "col" << cidx;
02836       //snprintf(colname_buf,sizeof(colname_buf),"col%02d",cidx);
02837       defineColumn(line_clvl,cidx,stream.str());
02838       //
02839       f_read_column(&m_column_map[line_clvl][cidx]);
02840     }
02841   }
02842 
02843   // skip past the end of this line...
02844   f_advance_eol();
02845 
02846   return TSV_OK;
02847 }
02848 
02849 std::fstream::pos_type affx::TsvFile::line_fpos()
02850 {
02851   return m_line_fpos; 
02852 }
02853 
02855 
02858 TsvFileBinding*
02859 affx::TsvFile::linkvar_alloc()
02860 {
02861   TsvFileBinding* var=new TsvFileBinding();
02862   m_linkvars_vec.push_back(var);
02863   m_linkvars_done=false;
02864   return var;
02865 }
02866 
02868 void
02869 affx::TsvFile::linkvars_clear()
02870 {
02871   //
02872   m_linkvars_done=false;
02873   m_linkvars_errors=0;
02874   m_linkvars_warnings=0;
02875   //
02876   unsigned int m_column_map_size=m_column_map.size();
02877   for (unsigned int clvl=0;clvl<m_column_map_size;clvl++) {
02878     unsigned int m_column_map_clvl_size=m_column_map[clvl].size();
02879     for (unsigned int cidx=0;cidx<m_column_map_clvl_size;cidx++) {
02880       m_column_map[clvl][cidx].linkedvars_clear();
02881     }
02882   }
02883 }
02884 
02885 void
02886 affx::TsvFile::linkvars_free()
02887 {
02888   linkvars_clear();
02889   for (int i=0;i<m_linkvars_vec.size();i++) {
02890     delete m_linkvars_vec[i];
02891     m_linkvars_vec[i]=NULL;
02892   }
02893   m_linkvars_vec.clear();
02894 }
02895   
02900 void
02901 affx::TsvFile::linkvar_column(int clvl,int cidx,TsvFileBinding* var)
02902 {
02903   var->islinked=false;
02904   TsvFileField* col=clvlcidx2colptr(clvl,cidx);
02905 
02906   if (col==NULL) {
02907     // out of bounds
02908     m_linkvars_errors++;
02909     return;
02910   }
02911   // found the column, copy over info
02912   col->linkedvar_push(var);
02913   var->islinked=true;
02914 }
02915 
02918 void
02919 affx::TsvFile::linkvar_link(TsvFileBinding* var)
02920 {
02921   assert(var!=NULL);
02922 
02923   //printf("link=%p errs=%d\n",var,m_linkvars_errors);
02924   if (var->m_bindto_type==TSV_BINDTO_NONE) {
02925     // dead
02926   }
02927   else if (var->m_bindto_type==TSV_BINDTO_CIDX) { // by index
02928     linkvar_column(var->m_bindto_clvl,var->m_bindto_cidx,var);
02929   }
02930   else if (var->m_bindto_type==TSV_BINDTO_CNAME) { // by name
02931     int cidx=cname2cidx(var->m_bindto_clvl,var->m_bindto_cname);
02932     if (cidx>=0) {
02933       linkvar_column(var->m_bindto_clvl,cidx,var);
02934     }
02935   } else {
02936     TSV_ERR_ABORT("linkvar_link: internal error: m_bindto_type="+ToStr(var->m_bindto_type));
02937   }
02938 
02939   // check the binding condition...
02940   if (var->islinked==true) {   // no need to check
02941     return;
02942   }
02943   if ((var->m_flags&TSV_BIND_REQUIRED)!=0) {
02944     m_linkvars_errors++;
02945     if (m_optAbortOnError) {
02946       TSV_ERR_ABORT("Required column: '"+ToStr(var->m_bindto_cname)+"' not found in file: '"+m_fileName+"'.");
02947     }
02948     return;
02949   }
02950   if ((var->m_flags&TSV_BIND_WARNING)!=0) {
02951     m_linkvars_warnings++;
02952     return;
02953   }
02954 }
02955 
02958 int
02959 affx::TsvFile::linkvars_makelinks()
02960 {
02961   // zap the current linkages
02962   linkvars_clear();
02963   // walk the vars and link them all
02964   unsigned int m_linkvars_vec_size=m_linkvars_vec.size();
02965   for (unsigned int vi=0;vi<m_linkvars_vec_size;vi++) {
02966     linkvar_link(m_linkvars_vec[vi]);
02967   }
02968   //
02969   m_linkvars_done=true;
02970   return m_linkvars_errors;
02971 }
02972 
02975 int
02976 affx::TsvFile::linkvars_maybe()
02977 {
02978   if (m_linkvars_done) {
02979     return m_linkvars_errors;
02980   }
02981   if (!(m_fileStream.is_open())) {
02982     return 0;
02983   }
02984   return linkvars_makelinks();
02985 }
02986 
02989 int
02990 affx::TsvFile::bindErrorCnt()
02991 {
02992   // make sure the links are in place.
02993   linkvars_maybe();
02994   // report the number of links we couldnt make
02995   return m_linkvars_errors;
02996 }
02997 
03000 int
03001 affx::TsvFile::formatOk()
03002 {
03003   if (bindErrorCnt()==0) {
03004     return TSV_OK;
03005   }
03006   // print the errors
03007   printBindingErrors();
03008 
03009   return (TSV_ERR_FORMAT);
03010 }
03011 
03013 void
03014 affx::TsvFile::printBindingErrors()
03015 {
03016   for (unsigned int i=0;i<m_linkvars_vec.size();i++) {
03017     if (!m_linkvars_vec[i]->islinked) { // oh no!
03018       if ((m_linkvars_vec[i]->m_flags&(TSV_BIND_WARNING|TSV_BIND_REQUIRED))!=0) {
03019         Verbose::out(2, "TSV: warning: did not bind ('" +
03020                      ToStr(m_linkvars_vec[i]->m_bindto_clvl) + "," +
03021                      ToStr(m_linkvars_vec[i]->m_bindto_cidx) + ",'" +
03022                      m_linkvars_vec[i]->m_bindto_cname +"')");
03023       }
03024     }
03025   }
03026 }
03027 
03029 void
03030 affx::TsvFile::unbindAll()
03031 {
03032   clearBindings();
03033 }
03034 
03036 
03038 #define TSV_BIND_FUNC(Xtype,Xfield) \
03039 int \
03040 affx::TsvFile::bind(int clvl,int cidx,Xtype* ptr,tsv_bindopt_t flags,int interncache_size) \
03041 { \
03042   TsvFileBinding* var=linkvar_alloc(); \
03043   var->m_bindto_type=TSV_BINDTO_CIDX; \
03044   var->m_bindto_clvl=clvl; \
03045   var->m_bindto_cidx=cidx; \
03046   var->m_flags=flags; \
03047   var->m_interncache_size=interncache_size; \
03048   var->Xfield=ptr; \
03049 \
03050   linkvars_maybe(); \
03051 \
03052   return TSV_OK; \
03053 } \
03054 int \
03055 affx::TsvFile::bind(int clvl,const std::string& cname,Xtype* ptr,tsv_bindopt_t flags,int interncache_size) \
03056 { \
03057   TsvFileBinding* var=linkvar_alloc(); \
03058   var->m_bindto_type=TSV_BINDTO_CNAME; \
03059   var->m_bindto_clvl=clvl; \
03060   var->m_bindto_cname=cname; \
03061   var->m_flags=flags; \
03062   var->m_interncache_size=interncache_size; \
03063   var->Xfield=ptr; \
03064 \
03065   linkvars_maybe(); \
03066 \
03067   return TSV_OK; \
03068 }
03069 
03070 // Expand the above
03071 TSV_BIND_FUNC(std::string,m_ptr_string);
03072 TSV_BIND_FUNC(int,m_ptr_int);
03073 TSV_BIND_FUNC(double,m_ptr_double);
03074 TSV_BIND_FUNC(float,m_ptr_float);
03075 TSV_BIND_FUNC(unsigned int,m_ptr_uint);
03076 TSV_BIND_FUNC(uint64_t,m_ptr_ulonglong);
03077 
03078 // dont need this any more.
03079 #undef TSV_BIND_FUNC
03080 
03082 
03085 int
03086 affx::TsvFile::rewind()
03087 {
03088   clearFields();
03089   m_fileStream.clear();
03090   m_fileStream.seekg(m_fileDataPos);
03091   //
03092   m_lineLvl=0;
03093   m_lineNum=0;
03094   m_eof=false;
03095   //
03096   if (!m_fileStream.good()) {
03097     m_eof=true;
03098     return (TSV_ERR_FILEIO);
03099   }
03100   return TSV_OK;
03101 }
03102 
03105 int
03106 affx::TsvFile::nextLine()
03107 {
03108   // insure the vars are inplace
03109   // we do this after the bind calls
03110   // linkvars_maybe();
03111 
03112   // some sort of error or eof?
03113   //if ((!m_fileStream.good())||(m_fileStream.peek()==EOF)) {
03114   if ((!m_fileStream.good())||(M_PEEK()==EOF)) {
03115     m_eof=true;
03116     return (TSV_ERR_FILEIO);
03117   }
03118 
03119   // insure the vars are inplace
03120   //linkvars_maybe();
03121 
03122   // count the tabs to figure out what level it is at
03123   m_lineLvl=f_advance_tabs();
03124   if (m_lineLvl<0) {
03125     f_advance_eol();
03126     return TSV_OK;
03127   }
03128 
03129   // Read the data into the columns
03130   return f_read_columns(m_lineLvl);
03131 }
03132 
03138 int
03139 affx::TsvFile::nextLevel(int seek_clvl)
03140 {
03141   char c = '\0';
03142   // insure the vars are inplace
03143   // linkvars_maybe();
03144 
03145   // Read lines until we find a line of the correct level.
03146   while (1) {
03147     if (!m_fileStream.good()) {
03148       clearFields();
03149       m_eof=true;
03150       return (TSV_ERR_FILEIO);
03151     }
03152     c = M_PEEK();
03153     // speed tweak to avoid uncessary seek. Unless this is the 0 level
03154     // the first character should be a tab. This handles a common case
03155     // in pgf files.
03156     if(seek_clvl != 0 && c != TSV_CHAR_TAB && c != TSV_CHAR_COMMENT) {
03157       return TSV_LEVEL_LAST;
03158     }
03159     else if (c == EOF) {
03160       clearFields();
03161       return TSV_ERR_EOF;
03162     }
03163 
03164     // what level is this line at?
03165     m_lineLvl=f_advance_tabs();
03166 
03167     // skip the line if it isnt a data line.
03168     if (m_lineLvl<0) {
03169       f_advance_eol();
03170       continue;
03171     }
03172 
03173     // a match; bind and return
03174     if (m_lineLvl==seek_clvl) {
03175       return f_read_columns(m_lineLvl);
03176     }
03177     // a master; dont skip it
03178     if (m_lineLvl<seek_clvl) {
03179       m_fileStream.seekg(m_line_fpos);
03180       return TSV_LEVEL_LAST;
03181     }
03182     // a child; skip it
03183     if (m_lineLvl>seek_clvl) {
03184       f_advance_eol();
03185     }
03186   }
03187   return (TSV_ERR_UNKNOWN);
03188 }
03189 
03191 
03192 
03193 
03196 int
03197 affx::TsvFile::deduce_types()
03198 {
03199   std::vector<int> clvl_seen;
03200   int clvl_seen_cnt;
03201   int clvl_max;
03202   int clvl;
03203   int cidx_max;
03204   int cidx;
03205   int seen_all_levels=0;
03206 
03207   // start from the beginning.
03208   rewind();
03209 
03210   //
03211   clvl_seen.resize(getLevelCount(),0);
03212   clvl_seen_cnt=0;
03213   clvl_max=getLevelCount();
03214 
03215   while (nextLine()==affx::TSV_OK) {
03216     clvl=lineLevel();
03217     // skip if we have done this level already...
03218     if (clvl_seen[clvl]==1) {
03219       continue;
03220     }
03221     // mark being seen.
03222     clvl_seen[clvl]=1;
03223     clvl_seen_cnt++;
03224 
03225     // scan the columns
03226     cidx_max=getColumnCount(clvl);
03227     for (cidx=0;cidx<cidx_max;cidx++) {
03228       // set type from value
03229       int tmp_int;
03230       double tmp_double;
03231       std::string tmp_string;
03232       if (get(clvl,cidx,tmp_int)==affx::TSV_OK) {
03233         set_type(clvl,cidx,affx::TSV_TYPE_INT);
03234       }
03235       else if (get(clvl,cidx,tmp_double)==affx::TSV_OK) {
03236         set_type(clvl,cidx,affx::TSV_TYPE_DOUBLE);
03237       }
03238       else if (get(clvl,cidx,tmp_string)==affx::TSV_OK) {
03239         set_type(clvl,cidx,affx::TSV_TYPE_STRING);
03240       }
03241       else {
03242         set_type(clvl,cidx,affx::TSV_TYPE_UNKNOWN);
03243       }
03244     }
03245       // all levels seen?
03246     if (clvl_seen_cnt==clvl_max) {
03247       seen_all_levels=1;
03248       break;
03249     }
03250   }
03251 
03252   // rewind and return
03253   rewind();
03254   //
03255   return ((seen_all_levels==1)?affx::TSV_OK:affx::TSV_ERR_UNKNOWN);
03256 }
03257 
03258 int
03259 affx::TsvFile::clear_max_sizes()
03260 {
03261   // reset the sizes
03262   for (unsigned int clvl=0;clvl<m_column_map.size();++clvl) {
03263     for (unsigned int cidx=0;cidx<m_column_map[clvl].size();cidx++) {
03264       m_column_map[clvl][cidx].m_max_size=0;
03265     }
03266   }
03267   return affx::TSV_OK;
03268 }
03269 
03270 int
03271 affx::TsvFile::deduce_sizes()
03272 {
03273   clear_max_sizes();
03274 
03275   // start from the beginning.
03276   rewind();
03277 
03278   TsvFileField* col;
03279   unsigned int clvl;
03280   //
03281   while (nextLine()==affx::TSV_OK) {
03282     clvl=lineLevel();
03283     // scan the columns
03284     int cidx_max=getColumnCount(clvl);
03285     for (int cidx=0;cidx<cidx_max;cidx++) {
03286       col=&m_column_map[clvl][cidx];
03287       int col_cur_size=col->m_buffer.size();
03288       if (col_cur_size>col->m_max_size) {
03289         col->m_max_size=col_cur_size;
03290       }
03291     }
03292   }
03293 
03294   // rewind and return
03295   rewind();
03296   return affx::TSV_OK;
03297 }

03655 
03658 void
03659 affx::TsvFile::dump()
03660 {
03661   //
03662   printf("TsvDump====================\n");
03663   printf("== tsv: filename='%s'\n",m_fileName.c_str());
03664   dump_headers();
03665   dump_bindings();
03666   printf("====================\n");
03667 }
03668 
03671 void
03672 affx::TsvFile::dump_headers()
03673 {
03674   printf("=== headers:\n");
03675   affx::TsvFile::header_t* h_ptr;
03676   for (int hi=0;hi<(int)m_headers_vec.size();hi++) {
03677     h_ptr=m_headers_vec[hi];
03678     printf("==header: ");
03679     if (h_ptr==NULL) {
03680       printf("NULL\n");
03681       continue;
03682     }
03683     if (h_ptr->m_key=="") {
03684       printf("%2d:#%s\n",h_ptr->m_order,h_ptr->m_value.c_str());
03685     } else {
03686       printf("%2d:#%%%s=%s\n",h_ptr->m_order,h_ptr->m_key.c_str(),h_ptr->m_value.c_str());
03687     }
03688   }
03689 
03690   //
03691   for (unsigned int clvl=0;clvl<m_column_map.size();++clvl) {
03692     for (unsigned int col=0;col<m_column_map[clvl].size();col++) {
03693       printf("==map: %3d: %3d : %s\n",clvl,col,m_column_map[clvl][col].m_cname.c_str());
03694     }
03695   }
03696 }
03697 
03700 void
03701 affx::TsvFile::dump_bindings()
03702 {
03703   printf("==bindings:\n");
03704 
03705   for (unsigned int vi=0;vi<m_linkvars_vec.size();vi++) {
03706     TsvFileBinding* var=m_linkvars_vec[vi];
03707     printf("%3d : %p : bound to clvl=%2d cidx=%2d cname='%s')\n",
03708            vi,var,
03709            var->m_bindto_clvl,var->m_bindto_cidx,var->m_bindto_cname.c_str());
03710   }
03711 }
03712 
03715 void
03716 affx::TsvFile::dump_data()
03717 {
03718   string tmpstr;
03719 
03720   while (nextLine()==TSV_OK) {
03721     int clvl=lineLevel();
03722     printf("%02d :",clvl);
03723     for (int cidx=0;cidx<getColumnCount(clvl);cidx++) {
03724       if (cidx!=0) {
03725         //printf("%c",m_optFieldSep);
03726         printf("|");
03727       }
03728       get(clvl,cidx,tmpstr);
03729       printf("%d='%s'",cidx,tmpstr.c_str());
03730     }
03731     printf("\n");
03732   }
03733   printf("== Read %6d lines\n",m_lineNum);
03734 }
03735 
03736 
03739 void
03740 affx::TsvFile::dump_indexes()
03741 {
03742   printf("indexes ------------------------------\n");
03743   for (unsigned int i=0;i<m_index_vec.size();i++) {
03744     TsvFileIndex* idx=m_index_vec[i];
03745     if (idx!=NULL) {
03746       idx->dump();
03747     }
03748   }
03749 }

03752 
03755 TsvFileIndex*
03756 affx::TsvFile::index_alloc()
03757 {
03758   TsvFileIndex* idx=new TsvFileIndex;
03759   m_index_vec.push_back(idx);
03760   // we will need to index
03761   m_index_done=false;
03762   return idx;
03763 }
03764 
03772 int
03773 affx::TsvFile::defineIndex(int clvl,const std::string& cname,int kind,int flags)
03774 {
03775   TsvFileIndex* idx=index_alloc();
03776   idx->m_bindto_type=TSV_BINDTO_CNAME;
03777   idx->m_bindto_clvl=clvl;
03778   idx->m_bindto_cname=cname;
03779   //
03780   assert(kind!=0);
03781   idx->m_kind=kind;
03782   idx->m_flags=flags;
03783   //
03784   return TSV_OK;
03785 }
03786 
03793 int
03794 affx::TsvFile::defineIndex(int clvl,int cidx,int kind,int flags)
03795 {
